page.title: 05RURAL TRANSPORT
page.content: RURAL TRANSPORT. In Codrington ,a small settlement just outside Bristol the roads are narrow.There are no pavements making it very dangerous for pedestrians , especially as people who drive on these roads drive fast and carelessly because they do not expectto meet much traffic in the country.In Codrington there is only one bus a week to Yate on a Friday,returning an hour and a half later,which is not very convenient.All the villagers have cars and say that you must have one to live in the country as there are no local shops and they have to go to Bristol,Yate or Chipping Sodbury.Most villagers think that the Motorway is an advantage as they can reach Bristol very quickly, but some prefer to go through the quiet country roads even if takes longer.
